net.gliblybits.bitsengine.utils

Class BitsObjectPool<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.gliblybits.bitsengine.utils.BitsObjectPool<T>

  • public abstract class BitsObjectPool<T>
extends java.lang.Object
    This class enables the pooling of the engine.
    It fills a BitsFixedSizeArray with a given number and types
    of objects.
    Other classes may check out and use these objects.
    If these objects are not needed anymore, they must be checked in
    into the pool again.

    Since:
    0.1 - Streak
    Version:
    0.1 - Streak
    Author:
    Marc Wiedenhoeft - GliblyBits

      • mObjects

        public BitsFixedSizeArray<T> mObjects
        The FixedSizeArray for pooling.
        It contains the pooled objects.

    • Method Detail

      • init

        public final void init(int size)
        This method initializes the object pool.
        It creates a BitsFixedSizeArray as a pool and
        calls the abstract fill method afterwards.

        Parameters:
        size - - size of the pool

      • checkOut

        public abstract T checkOut()
        Gets an object out of the pool and returns it
        to the function caller.
        If there are no more objects in the pool,
        this method will return NULL.

        Returns:
        object from pool or NULL if pool is empty

      • checkIn

        public abstract void checkIn(T entry)
        Puts the given object back into the pool.

      • getCheckedOutCount

        public final int getCheckedOutCount()
        Returns the number of object that have been,
        checked out but not yet checked in again.
